page.title: 04CLOTH HALL FARM
page.content: When the church there was renovated. The Vicar is Father David from Penistone Church. {CLOTH HALL FARM} We do not know the age of cloth Hall farm, but a new part was built in 1723. It is owned by the Battyes and was passed on from mr. Battye's grandfather to his dad, to him. They have got 107 acres of land all grass land and use silage not hay. They have got 62 dairy, 54 beef intensive, 3 lambs, 1 limosin bull called Ashwell Ermin. They get 100 litres ofmilk a day. The milk collector comes every day. they rear their own cows. There are 3 tractors, a Massey Ferguson and 2 Internationals. the cows have to be 2 years old for milking. They have 3 cats and 1 dog. They started milking in 1975. (cont.)
